text: [Music]
I'm Mitch Nelson I'm director of adobe's
managed Services Program we have a
couple of thousand folks on this site
part of an overall Workforce of uh more
than 10,000 people we operate around the
world our main product focus is in the
digital media and digital marketing
Realms where we engage with everything
from the desktop customer all the way
through to the largest Enterprise
employee I am responsible for bringing
three of our Enterprise products to
Market specifically our life cycle forms
product our connect web meeting product
and our CQ web experience management
product that last one is something that
we've brought to Market just within the
past couple of months and is really
showing strong traction and interest
amongst the Enterprise customer base
that we have
today Adobe has a strong partnership
with Amazon web services and we use the
Creative Cloud in a variety of different
ways this ranges from our creative
activities on one hand all the way
through to our Enterprise and government
activities on the other we have chosen
to focus on the AWS Cloud because the
the rich API set that the AWS Cloud
offers us allows us to deeply integrate
our automation systems into AWS and
provide a very efficient operating
environment for our
[Music]
customers so starting about 3 years ago
we started making Adobe live cycle which
is a forms-based
system available as an official Adobe
product we've uh now deployed our CQ web
experience management product uh onto
the Amazon Cloud we use everything from
the various different sizes of ec2
instance running both red hat and
windows we make extensive use of the EBS
system and are expanding that into
multi-terabyte per customer operating
infrastructures we are also
experimenting with a variety of other
Amazon products ranging from elastic
beant stock CDN operations and cloud
formation AWS does a great job of
providing that infrastructure that we
need
that allows us to focus on our software
product and deploying and operating that
if we go down we have to be able to get
back up very very quickly AWS does a
great job of helping us do that and when
we do have a problem AWS is there and
works with us to pull ourselves out of
that issue AWS has allowed us to deliver
products that we really couldn't deliver
in other ways and do it without the
massive investment that building our own
infrastructure in multiple multiple
locations around the world would
require adobe's relationship with AWS is
very important to it today and I think
that it will grow more critical as we
move into the
future
